RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since September 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIATUS settled off the early leaders, was a factor on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was kept to task. PARTY OF NO was up close, forced the pace on the far turn and from the four path at the top of the stretch held place. DIAMONDBACK was away alertly and had a slim lead on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. IRIE ISLAND MAN was off the pace, trailed the field throughout and was no real threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Party of No
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close, forced pace far turn, 4-path stretch, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Hiatus
ENTRY.OWNER: Voyce Jeff and McGirr Jr Herbert
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off leaders, factor far turn, 5path stretch, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Irie Island Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, trailed far turn, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Diamondback
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, slim lead far turn, 3-path stretch, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 15000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, if for $3,750, allowed 2 lbs. (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PICK A PENNY settled off the early leaders, moved up on the turn and with a bid from the five path in mid stretch proved best. WHISPER ME A SONG was hustled early from the inside, forced the pace on the turn and had the lead from the three path in mid stretch but was outgunned. LEMONSANDDIAMONDS showed speed from the inside, had a slim lead on the turn and vied through the stretch while all out. ALWAY'S ROSIE was in touch and raced evenly from the inside on the turn but needed more. SMART IRENE was unhurried early, trailed the field on the turn and had his best stride late. SOVEREIGN TALE was in range and roused on the turn but dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Lemonsanddiamonds
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, slim lead turn, vied stretch, all out

ENTRY.NAME: Whisper Me a Song
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, forced pace turn, led 3-path stretch, outgunned

ENTRY.NAME: Alway's Rosie
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly inside turn, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Pick a Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, moved up turn, bid 5-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Sovereign Tale
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Irene
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed turn, best stride late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario S ired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOUND LUCKY was off slow, had a bid on the turn and with the lead from the four path at the top of the stretch drew clear. EXECUTIVE GIANT was unhurried early and had a mild gain on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. BEND IN THE RIVER was off the pace, saved ground on the turn and angled outside in mid stretch to get up for show. LIL GREEN MACHINE stalked the early leaders and raced evenly on the turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch leveled off. NAVAL OFFICER was away alertly and a factor on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was empty. GUNZIG STINGER was hustled early and had the lead on the turn but pulled up in mid stretch and was vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Bend in the River
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground turn, angled out stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Green Machine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leaders, evenly turn, 5-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Bound Lucky
ENTRY.OWNER: Beharry Vinodh H and Ceccato Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, bid turn, led 4-path stretch, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Gunzig Stinger
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, led turn, pulled up mid stretch, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Executive Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild gain turn, 6-path stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Naval Officer
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, factor turn, 6-path stretch, empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 21600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLAWLESS RULER was hustled early, took command on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was much the best. BEYOND TALENTED was off slow, gained ground on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch was second best. LE GRAND GARCON was in range and had a good position on the far turn but from the five path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. EIN WAHRER SOLDAT settled off the early leaders and saved ground on the far turn but was no threat. TONKA WAKAN was in touch and a factor on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch faded. BLASITO was off the pace and showed little in a dull effort. NGABE was in mid pack but chased on the far turn and had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Blasito
ENTRY.OWNER: Beharry Vinodh H and Ceccato Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, showed little, dull effort

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Talented
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, gained ground far turn, 3-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Le Grand Garcon
ENTRY.OWNER: Steer, Thomas R. and Walpole, Lance R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, good position far turn, 5-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ein Wahrer Soldat
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off leaders, saved ground far turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Flawless Ruler
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled, took command far turn, 3-path stretch, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Tonka Wakan
ENTRY.OWNER: Steer, Thomas R. and Walpole, Lance R.
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, factor far turn, 4-path stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Ngabe
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, chased far turn, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 22200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less N ot Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HALF TO RELOAD set the pace, had the lead on the turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch held sway. GRAND GIZMO was in touch, had a mild gain on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was up for place. ARTIE'S ALL IN was off slow, closed the gap on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch finished well. DON'T STOP DREAMIN tracked the early leader and was a factor on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch weakened. LOADED SECRET was off the pace and roused from the inside on the turn but had no response. J M R TUREK was in range and hustled along on the turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch failed to fire.

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Gizmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, mild gain turn, 5-path stretch, up for place.

ENTRY.NAME: Artie's All In
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, closed gap turn, 6-path stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Stop Dreamin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, factor turn, 4-path stretch, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Half to Reload
ENTRY.OWNER: Ascot Stud Blake Sr Michael S Stout Mark and Stocker-Parks Rachel
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, led turn, 3-path stretch, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Loaded Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, roused inside turn, no response

ENTRY.NAME: J M R Turek
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, hustled along turn, 7-path stretch, failed to fire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOUEMMA settled off the early leaders, moved up on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch proved best. ORBITING THE SKY was off the pace, saved ground on the turn and rallied late. FRESH DREAMS was unhurried early, raced evenly on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was up for show. LITTLE FIRE had no speed and was hustled along on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch needed more. REMEMBEROLDTYMES stalked the early leader and was a factor on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch leveled off. EASY ACCESS showed speed from the inside and had a clear lead on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Easy Access
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside, clear lead turn, 3-path stretch, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberoldtymes
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor turn, 4-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Fresh Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, evenly turn, 5-path stretch, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Orbiting the Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground turn, rallied late

ENTRY.NAME: Louemma
ENTRY.OWNER: Ascot Stud Willwerth James and Stocker-Parks Rachel
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off leaders, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Little Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, hustled along turn, 6-path stretch, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 7F Turf CR: 87. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (C olts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited to 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOT'S VISION stalked the early leader, was a factor on the far turn and widened under light handling through the stretch. SYNCHROMESH was off slow, moved up on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was second best. BEYOND BORDERS was in mid pack and roused on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch needed more. DE ONLY SOLUTION was in touch and raced evenly on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no late kick. UNION COLONEL was in range and a factor on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch failed to fire. DOCTOR UPTOWN was off the pace and hustled along on the far turn but from the seven path at the top of the stretch had no rally. LOQUACIOUS was well back and saved ground on the far turn but was never in contention. W W SPRINGTIME set the pace but was headed on the far turn and dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Union Colonel
ENTRY.OWNER: Warner, Nancy E. and Robert K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, factor far turn, 3-path stretch, failed to fire

ENTRY.NAME: Loquacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, saved ground far turn, never in contention

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Borders
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, roused far turn, 4-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Uptown
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, hustled along far turn, 7-path stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: De Only Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, evenly far turn, 4-path stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Synchromesh
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, moved up far turn, 5-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: W W Springtime
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, headed far turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Dot's Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, forced pace far turn, widened under light handling
